Define relationships with covariates

Source: R/sim_dist.R
sim_parabola.Rd

Closure to be used in sim_distribution

sim_parabola(alpha = 0, mu = 200, sigma = 70, plot = FALSE)

Arguments

alpha, mu, sigma

Parameters that control the shape of the parabola
plot

Produce a simple plot of the simulated values?

Examples


parabola_fun <- sim_parabola(alpha = 25, mu = 50, sigma = 5, plot = TRUE)
parabola_fun(x = 0:100)
#>   [1] -25.00 -23.02 -21.08 -19.18 -17.32 -15.50 -13.72 -11.98 -10.28  -8.62
#>  [11]  -7.00  -5.42  -3.88  -2.38  -0.92   0.50   1.88   3.22   4.52   5.78
#>  [21]   7.00   8.18   9.32  10.42  11.48  12.50  13.48  14.42  15.32  16.18
#>  [31]  17.00  17.78  18.52  19.22  19.88  20.50  21.08  21.62  22.12  22.58
#>  [41]  23.00  23.38  23.72  24.02  24.28  24.50  24.68  24.82  24.92  24.98
#>  [51]  25.00  24.98  24.92  24.82  24.68  24.50  24.28  24.02  23.72  23.38
#>  [61]  23.00  22.58  22.12  21.62  21.08  20.50  19.88  19.22  18.52  17.78
#>  [71]  17.00  16.18  15.32  14.42  13.48  12.50  11.48  10.42   9.32   8.18
#>  [81]   7.00   5.78   4.52   3.22   1.88   0.50  -0.92  -2.38  -3.88  -5.42

#> [101] -25.00
